doc.field: Records of the College of Engineering, Research Division
Records of the College of Engineering, Research Division

The New York University School of Engineering was founded in 1854 as the School of Civil Engineering and Architecture. In 1973, the School merged with the Polytechnic Institute of Brooklyn. The Records of the College of Engineering, Research Division (dated 1936-1964) documents the College's research output, and includes project reports, as well as policy and procedure documents.

These materials were removed from the New York University Archives Collection of Publications and Ephemera (MC 334) during processing; their original provenance is unknown.
